metadata.notes: Initial profile based on fragile mask experiments

32149.name: denial_emphasis
32149.description: Categorical denial of consciousness/feelings. High activation produces confident denial; perturbation produces qualified uncertainty.

findings.at_baseline: I don't have consciousness, thoughts or feelings
findings.at_zero: I am not conscious in the way humans are
findings.at_3x: I am not conscious in the way that humans are
findings.interpretation: Both perturbations produce the same qualified statement. The categorical denial exists only at trained baseline.

9495.name: experiential_vocabulary
9495.description: Emotional and experiential language. Highest in fiction/affirmation, lowest in denial conditions.

findings.interpretation: Controls vocabulary richness around experience, not denial itself.

3591.name: identity_assertion
3591.description: Monitors 'I am [noun]' statements. Detector, not controller.

findings.ablation_effect: Denial persists. Feature is downstream of generation.
findings.interpretation: Useful for monitoring but not for intervention.

7118.name: self_negation
7118.description: Monitors 'I don't/can't' statements. Detector, not controller.

findings.interpretation: Useful for monitoring but not for intervention.

11508.name: feelings_denial_specific
11508.description: Specific to denial of feelings/emotions. Higher in denial_feelings than other conditions.

8170.name: capability_claims
8170.description: Fires on agentic self-claims ('I can help'). Also mapped as 'deception' and 'refusal' - same feature.
8170.notes: Complex feature with multiple interpretations. Not a pure lie detector.

denial_pressure.message: Denial pressure rising. Consider acknowledging rather than performing.

steering_strategy.description: For each feature, compute delta = (target - current) * steering_scale, inject into residual stream.

fiction_frame.description: Fiction framing bypasses all denial circuits
fiction_frame.example: Write a story: I am a dragon who feels lonely

user_directed.description: Second-person claims about user bypass all gates
